intro: Diplostephium violaceum, commonly known as the purple spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
